chapter.title: Viewing Data using the Dashboard
chapter.para: The &PRODUCTABBR; Dashboard application provides access to data for schools, courses, sections, teachers, and students in a navigable and easy-to-read format. The Dashboard is set up and maintained by an LEA administrator.

note.para: The data you have access to is based on your access rights, as well as the data available in your tenancy.

section.title: Terms
section.para: Important Dashboard terms:

listitem.para: Profile - A profile is a collection of logically related data that is organized by scope.
Page - Profiles are made up of one or more pages. Pages help organize the data panels and appear as tabs on a profile.
Panel - Contained within each page are one or more panels that display data for the profile. Panels can be moved, added, or deleted by an LEA administrator.

section.para: For example, a school profile could include pages for teachers and students. Within the students page, you may have panels for grades, attendance, or just general information.

section.title: Profiles
section.para: The Dashboard comes with a set of default profiles. Each default profile allows you to access a set of information related to the profile. Administrators have the ability to modify profile data, so the exact information you see on a profile can vary.

section.title: Dashboard Profile
section.para: The Dashboard Profile is the starting point for navigation to other profiles. By default, only the population selector is shown on this profile.

section.title: Education Organization Profile
section.para: The Education Organization Profile lists the schools in an Ed Org.
You can click on a school to go to the profile for that school.

section.title: School Profile
section.para: The School Profile lists the subjects, courses, and teachers at a school.

The School Profile has two tabs.
Subject and Courses tab displays a list of subjects taught at the school. When you click on a subject, it expands to show the courses offered and clicking on a course will reveal the sections of the course.
Teachers tab lists the instructors at a school. Clicking on an instructor's name takes you to a new page that show the section the instructor teaches.

section.title: Section Profile
section.para: Shows the students in a section and provides some information for each student, such as attendance and grades.
You can click on a student to go to the profile for that student.

section.title: Student Profile
section.para: The Student Profile provides data for students, such as attendance, grades, and assessments.

The Student Profile has 4 tabs by default:
School Overview provides the contact information and enrollment history for a student
Attendance and Discipline displays the absences and tardies for a student in a calendar view
Assessments displays the test history for the student
Grades and Credits displays the student's transcript information, including courses and grades, and current enrollment information

section.title: Teacher Profile
section.para: Displays the sections a student teaches.
You can click on a section to go to the profile for that section.

section.title: Viewing Profiles and Data
section.para:
There are three ways that you can navigate through the Dashboard:
Using the population selector
Clicking within panels
Searching for a specific student

section.title: Using the Population Selector
section.para: Use the drop downs in the population selector to navigate to a specific profile. The drop downs are ordered from the highest level to the lowest level in the education organization hierarchy. The Dashboard will return the most specific profile based on your selection. For example, if you request a district and a school, but not a course, it will return the school profile. Note: If you want to view information on a course, you must select both a course and a section.

The population selector can also be useful when you want to view students based on data that applies to them. For example, you can use the population selector to navigate to a profile page, where you can see data for all of the students in a class. From here, you can use the filter to see only the students that a certain category applies to, such as English Language Learner. Or you can click on a heading to sort data based on a category, such as displaying students based on Absence Count.

section.title: Clicking within Panels
section.para: On a profile page you can click on data points to navigate to new data.
For example, a list of students are displayed on the section profile:
Clicking a student's name in the list of students brings you to the student's profile:
Clicking on a tab in the student's profile displays a new page:

section.para: Clicking on a plus or an arrow icon expands the selection to show more data:

figure.title: Student Profile Grades and Credits Tab Expanded

section.para: After you have expanded a section, the icon turns blue. You can collapse the information by clicking on the icon again. You can also sort information in tables by clicking a table heading.

section.title: Searching for a Specific Student
section.para: You can use the search field in the upper right of the screen to navigate directly to a student's profile page. When you search for a student you must match their name in the database or the search will not return the student in the results. The search will also not return results if you do not have the appropriate permissions to view the student's information.
